title: 2 teens hurt in Hampton drive-by shooting
content:
HAMPTON, Va. (WAVY) — Two 17-year-old boys were injured Tuesday night in a drive-by shooting on Hampton Roads Center Parkway.
Hampton police were called around 8:45 p.m. for two gunshot victims who had arrived at Sentara CarePlex Hospital.
Police say the two teens were passengers in a car traveling on the parkway, near Enterprise Parkway, when a white sedan drove up and someone began firing gunshots toward their car.
One of the teens was shot once. The other was grazed by a bullet. The driver of the car took both teens to Sentara CarePlex.
The exit ramp from Interstate 64 East to Hampton Roads Center Parkway was closed as police investigated the shooting. The ramp has since reopened.
Stay with WAVY.com for updates on this developing story.
